New Records: CJ McCollum scored a career high-tying 50 points with 10 3-pointers
Key Match Events: McCollum had his toe on the 3-point line when he hit a 21-foot jumper to give New Orleans a 128-111 lead. It was initially ruled a 3, which would have given him a career high in points and tied his franchise high of 11 made 3s. But it was reduced to a 2-point shot on video review.
Post-Match Reflections: The Pelicans have the NBA's worst record at 6-29, but now share with Washington (6-26) the dubious distinction of having the fewest victories in the league.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Orleans was playing at home for the first time since a deadly New Yearâ€™s Day attack in the French Quarter, and a moment of silence was held before tipoff.
